Class ScCbcMacPrepending

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.mac.ScCbcMacPrepending
All Implemented Interfaces:
CbcMac, Mac, UniqueTagMac, PrfVaryingInputLength, PseudorandomFunction, MacSignSecLevel, OneTime, SecurityLevel, UnlimitedTimes
public class ScCbcMacPrepending
extends java.lang.Object
implements CbcMac

Concrete class of CBC-Mac.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Detail

ScCbcMacPrepending

public ScCbcMacPrepending()
Default constructor. Uses default implementation of PRP and SecureRandom.

ScCbcMacPrepending

public ScCbcMacPrepending(java.lang.String prpName)
                   throws FactoriesException
Constructor that gets a prp name and sets it as the underlying prp. The source of randomness will be set with the default implementation.

Parameters:
prpName - the name of the underlying prp
Throws:
FactoriesException - if the creation of the prp failed
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given name is not a valid PrpFixed name.

ScCbcMacPrepending

public ScCbcMacPrepending(java.lang.String prpName,
                          java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
                   throws FactoriesException,
                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Constructor that gets a prp name and sets it as the underlying prp.

It also gets the name of a Random Number Generator Algorithm to use to generate the source of randomness.

Parameters:
prpName - the name of the underlying prp.
randNumGenAlg - the name of the RNG algorithm, for example "SHA1PRNG".
Throws:
FactoriesException - if the creation of the prp failed.
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given randNumGenAlg is not a valid random number generator algorithm's name.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given name is not a valid PrpFixed name.

ScCbcMacPrepending

Constructor that gets a prp object and sets it as the underlying prp.

Parameters:
prp - the name of the underlying prp

ScCbcMacPrepending

public ScCbcMacPrepending(PrpFixed prp,
                          java.security.SecureRandom random)
Constructor that gets a prp object and set it as the underlying prp and a SecureRandom object to use as source of randomness.

Parameters:
prp - the name of the underlying prp.
random - source of randomness.

generateKey

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                   throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
Generates a secret key to initialize this mac object. This function delegates the generation of the key to the underlying PRP. It should only be used if the Secret Key is not a string of random bits of a specified length.

Specified by:
generateKey in interface Mac
Specified by:
generateKey in interface PseudorandomFunction
Parameters:
keyParams - parameters needed to create the key.
Returns:
the generated secret key.
Throws:
java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if the given keyParams does not match the underlying prp.

Specified by:

Specified by:
generateKey in interface PseudorandomFunction
Parameters:
keySize - is the required secret key size in bits (it has to be greater than 0 a multiple of 8)
Returns:
the generated secret key.

startMac

public void startMac(int msgLength)
Pre-pends the length of the message to the message. As a result, the mac will be calculated on [msgLength||msg].

Specified by:
startMac in interface CbcMac
Parameters:
msgLength - the length of the message in bytes.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.

public byte[] mac(byte[] msg,
                  int offset,
                  int msgLen)
Computes the CBC-Mac operation on the given msg and returns the calculated tag.

Specified by:
mac in interface Mac
Parameters:
msg - the message to calculate the mac on.
offset - the offset within the message array to take the bytes from.
msgLen - the length of the message in bytes.
Returns:
byte[] the return tag from the mac operation.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.

verify

public boolean verify(byte[] msg,
                      int offset,
                      int msgLength,
                      byte[] tag)
Verifies that the given tag is valid for the given message.

Specified by:
verify in interface Mac
Parameters:
msg - the message to compute the cbc-mac on to verify the tag.
offset - the offset within the message array to take the bytes from.
msgLength - the length of the message in bytes.
tag - the tag to verify.
Returns:
true if the tag is the result of computing mac on the message. false, otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.

update

public void update(byte[] msg,
                   int offset,
                   int msgLen)
Adds the byte array to the existing message to mac.

Specified by:
update in interface Mac
Parameters:
msg - the message to add.
offset - the offset within the message array to take the bytes from.
msgLen - the length of the message in bytes.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the startMac function was not called.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given message is not aligned to this Mac size.

computeBlock

public void computeBlock(byte[] inBytes,
                         int inOff,
                         int inLen,
                         byte[] outBytes,
                         int outOff,
                         int outLen)
                  throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
Computes the mac operation.

Specified by:
computeBlock in interface PseudorandomFunction
Parameters:
inBytes - the msg.
inOff - the offset within the msg to take the bytes from.
inLen - the length of the msg in bytes.
outBytes - the output array.
outOff - the offset within the out array to put the result from.
outLen - the required length of the output array in bytes. Should be equal to this mac size.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if outLen is not equal to this mac size.
